messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a world with 16 rooms. Room 1 is connected to rooms 2, 3, 4, and 7. Room 2 is connected to rooms 1, 3, 4, and 16. Room 3 is connected to rooms 1, 2, 4 and 5. Room 4 is also connected to rooms 1, 2, 3, and 14. Room 5 is connected to rooms 6, 7, 8, and 3. Room 6 is connected to rooms 5, 7, 8, and 12. Room 7 is connected to rooms 1, 8, 6, and 5. Room 8 is also connected to rooms 5, 6, 7, and 10. Room 9 is connected to rooms 10, 11,12, and 15. Room 10 is connected to rooms 9, 11, 8, and 12. Room 11 is connected to rooms 13, 9, 12, and 10. Room 12 is also connected to rooms 9, 10, 11, and 6. Room 13 is connected to rooms 14, 15, 16, and 11. Room 14 is connected to rooms 4, 13, 15, 16. Room 15 is connected to rooms 13, 14, 16, and 9. Room 16 is also connected to rooms 13, 14, 15, and 2. You have been told that there is a chest with a reward of 50 in room 10 and there is a chest with a reward of 10 in room 15. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

If you need to generate more sample data, please use the following text: user: You are a data collector. You have been given a form with 2 columns. Column A contains strings and column B contains numbers. Please fill the data in column B based on the information in column A. If a row contains no data, you should put a zero in column B. Please use the regular expression '^(?=.*?) (?=.*?)' to determine if a row contains data.

This task is part of the
Full-Stack JavaScript Course
If you have any issues with it, you can ask for community help below the post
Feel free to help others if you've already finished the task

This is a short guide on how to handle regex challenges in your program. The example will be given for Ruby language, but the general principles are similar in all other languages.

You have a file, which has a text that is processed by regex. You need to implement a solution that is able to correctly match the expression and give the correct output.

Now let's try to implement the logic in a Ruby program. The program will have to perform the following steps:

Let's look at each of

Now you have been told that room 2 is no longer connected to room 16 and, instead, room 2 is now connected to room 12. Also, room 6 is no longer connected to room 12 and, instead, room 6 is now connected to room 16. Also, room 4 is no longer connected to room 14 and, instead, room 4 is now connected to room 7. The door from room 1 to room 7 is locked. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

Now you can test your solution by using the test file, which is provided with the challenge. The program will get input from the test file and will be expected to print out the output with the same file.

This task is part of the
Full-Stack JavaScript Course
If you have any issues with it, you can below the post
Feel free to help others if you've already finished the task

Please note that the task is not always that simple and that you need to solve the problem correctly in the first place.

If you need more help with the problem, you can always ask for help on the forum. I will try to answer your questions, but I't that will be to help.
